Authors:
Chanokned Senwanna, Sinang Hongsanan, Rungtiwa Phookamsak,
Saowaluck Tibpromma, Ratchadawan Cheewangkoon, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Muyocopron heveae sp. nov. and M. dipterocrpi appear to have
jumped hosts to rubber
Keywords:
1 new specie, Dothideomycetes, Euphorbiaceae,
Muyocopronales, phylogenetic, taxonomy
Abstract:
Muyocopron species were collected from dried branches of
Hevea brasiliensis in Thailand. These were studied and compared with
related taxa, based on the evidence from morphology and phylogenetic
analyses of a combined LSU and SSU DNA sequence data. A new host record,
Muyocopron dipterocarpi and a new taxon, Muyocopron heveae are described
and illustrated. Muyocopron heveae can be differentiated from the
previously described species of Muyocopron in its asci and ascospores
dimensions. Phylogenetic analyses of a combined LSU and SSU sequence
data indicated that our strains cluster in Muyocopron and the new taxon
forms a distinct clade as a new species in the genus. The germinating
ascospores produced appressoria which suggests it has an endophytic
lifestyle. The taxa appear to have jumped host to rubber, which had been
introduced to Thailand.
